title:
Magnetic field diagnostics of prominences with the Mg II k line: 3D
  Stokes inversions versus traditional methods
authors:
Ji\v{r}\'i \v{S}t\v{e}p\'an, Tanaus\'u del Pino Alem\'an, Javier
  Trujillo Bueno
abstract:
The Mg II k resonance line is commonly used for diagnosing the solar
chromosphere. We theoretically investigated its intensity and polarization in
solar prominences, taking 3D radiative transfer and Hanle and Zeeman effects
into account. We used an optically thick 3D model representative of a solar
prominence and applied several inversion methods to the synthetic Stokes
profiles, clarifying their pros and cons for inferring prominence magnetic
fields. We conclude that the self-consistent 3D inversion with radiative
transfer is necessary to determine the magnetic field vector, although its
geometry cannot be inferred with full fidelity. We also demonstrate that more
traditional methods, such as those based on the weak field approximation or the
constant-property slab assumption, can offer useful information under certain
conditions.
